content.description:
Sage Mode has some of the most rad moves on rock. Iif technical kneebars and power endurance are your thing, do this boulder. If not, do this boulder.

Start sitting in the middle of the roof on a left hand gaston edge and right hand blocky crimp jug. Move to a sweet undercling feature, then move through a technical kneebar to gain the arete. Follow the pumpy arete to an easy topout at the apex of the boulder.
content.protection: A few pads. It has a pretty okay landing.
content.location: It is on the right side of the Master Roof, starting in the middle of it and trending right to the arete.

content.description:
This is an absolutely phenomenal testpiece on some of the finest granite in the state, in one of the most beautiful locations in the state. The workability of this line as well as the consistency of difficulty make this a perfect V10 for someone entering the grade.

Begin sitting at the bottom of the low roof on a left hand gaston dish/pocket and a right hand white sidepull edge. Make crimpy moves through the roof until a sloper sequence and some foot first action at the lip. End with a victory topout on jugs.

Apparently a stand (read: higher squat start) exists at V9ish beginning halfway through the problem on a small, sharp left crimp and right edge a few inches over. Move immediately with your left hand to the first sloper rail, and continue.
content.protection: A few pads. This has a nice, flat, talus landing.
content.location: It is on the west roof of Boulder #3 - this roof is very obvious and holds a few problems on perfect rock. Master of Puppets is the left line of the main roof and starts in the center of it but trends left.
